contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox river | river_name = Wise River | image_name = | image_size = | caption = | origin = | mouth = {{Coord|45|47|56|N|112|56|47|W |display=title,inline|name=Wise River}}<ref name=gnis>{{cite gnis |id=793435 |name=Wise River}}</ref> | basin_countries = [[Beaverhead County, Montana]] | progression = | length = {{convert|30|mi|km}} | elevation = | mouth_elevation = {{convert|5607|ft|m}}<ref name=gnis/> | discharge = | watershed = | river_system = [[Missouri River]] | left_tribs = | right_tribs = }} The '''Wise River''' is a tributary of the [[Big Hole River]], approximately 30 mi (48 km) long, in southwestern [[Montana]] in the [[United States]]. It rises in the [[Beaverhead National Forest]] in the [[Pioneer Mountains (Montana)|Pioneer Mountains]] in [[Beaverhead County, Montana|Beaverhead County]]. It flows NNW through the mountains and joins the Big Hole near the town of [[Wise River, Montana|Wise River]]. The river has also been known as Elkhorn Creek.<ref name=gnis/> The river is a popular destination for [[fly fishing]]. The Wise is a Class II river for stream access for recreational purposes.<ref name=StreamAccess>[http://fwp.mt.gov/content/getItem.aspx?id=24929 Stream Access in Montana]</ref> ==See also== *[[List of rivers of Montana]] *[[Montana Stream Access Law]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{Montana}} [[Category:Rivers of Montana]] [[Category:Landforms of Beaverhead County, Montana]] {{Montana-geo-stub}}
